intro: Malachra urens var. sublobata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its small, sparsely branched stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils. The species is also known for its ability to thrive in harsh, dry conditions with minimal water requirements.
